intro: Eleocharis montevidensis var. disciformis, commonly known as the disc-shaped spikerush, is a perennial grass-like plant native to South America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its cylindrical, spike-like inflorescence and small, wind-pollinated flowers. It typically grows in wetland environments such as marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its structure and growth habits make it an important component of aquatic and riparian ecosystems.
